ko: 톰은 자기 개가 낯선 사람을 보면 짖도록 길들였어.

en: A stranger seized me by the arm.
ko: 어떤 낯선 사람이 내 팔을 붙잡았어.

en: A stranger came up and asked me the way to the hospital.
ko: 웬 모르는 사람이 다가와서 병원 가는 길을 물었어.

en: You shouldn't accept candy from strangers.
ko: 모르는 사람이 주는 사탕은 받으면 안 돼.

en: See to it that no strangers come into this room.
ko: 이 방에 낯선 사람이 못 들어오게 잘 지켜봐.

en: You must beware of strange dogs.
No, I don't. You had better look it up in a telephone directory.
ko: 아니, 몰라. 전화번호부에서 찾아보는 게 좋겠어.

en: Where ignorance is bliss, 'tis folly to be wise.
ko: 모르는 게 약일 때는 아는 게 오히려 독이야.

en: The years go by before I know, so I don't wanna miss this chance.
ko: 나도 모르게 세월이 다 가버리니까 이번 기회를 놓치고 싶지 않아.

en: His face fell when he heard the news.
ko: 그 소식을 듣고 그 사람 표정이 확 어두워졌어.

en: Before I knew it, the plane had landed.
They were excited at the news.
The news was very surprising to her.
ko: 그 소식 듣고 그 여자애 진짜 놀랐어.

en: Please let me know.
It is one thing to know and another to teach.
ko: 아는 거랑 가르치는 건 또 다른 문제야.

en: It is impossible, you know, to make him agree.
ko: 걔를 설득하는 건 불가능해, 너도 알잖아.

en: If only I knew, I would tell you all that I knew.
ko: 내가 알기만 했으면 아는 거 다 말해줬을 거야.

en: If he knows the truth, he will tell us.
ko: 걔가 사실을 알면 우리한테 말해줄 거야.

en: Had I known it, I would have told you.
If I'd known it, I'd have told you.
If I had known it, I would have told you.
If only I knew!
Well you can imitate everyone you know.
ko: 뭐, 네가 아는 사람들은 다 흉내 낼 수 있잖아.

en: To know is one thing, to practice another.
To know is one thing, and to do is another.
Knowing is one thing, teaching quite another.
ko: 아는 거랑 가르치는 건 완전히 다른 일이야.

en: To know is one thing, to teach is another.
To know is one thing, and quite another to do.
ko: 아는 거랑 실제로 하는 건 천지 차이야.

en: If he had known, he might have come earlier.
ko: 걔가 알았으면 더 일찍 왔을지도 몰라.

en: Did you ask the price?
Can you guess the price?
We fixed the price at $15.
The price was absurdly high.
Apart from the cost, the dress doesn't suit me.
ko: 가격은 둘째치고, 그 원피스 나한테 안 어울려.

en: The price depends on the size.
Cost is a definite factor in making our decision.
ko: 결정할 때 비용이 확실히 중요한 요소야.

en: The price is none too high.
The price was only three thousand yen, or about thirty dollars.
ko: 가격은 겨우 3천 엔, 그러니까 한 30달러 정도였어.

en: Apart from the cost, the color of the tie doesn't suit me.
ko: 가격은 제쳐두고, 넥타이 색깔이 나랑 안 어울려.

en: Apart from the cost, the dress doesn't suit you.
ko: 가격을 떠나서 그 드레스 너한테 안 어울려.

en: The price is up to you.
I will take the one that is more expensive.
Expensive things often prove more economical in the long run.
ko: 결국엔 비싼 게 더 경제적일 때가 많아.

en: The price did not enter into our consideration.
The price includes the consumption tax.
If the price is reasonable, I want to buy the car.
ko: 가격만 적당하면 그 차 사고 싶어.

en: I was agreeably surprised by the low prices.
Could you take off the price tag for me?
Please let us know your conditions for making the concession.
Could you give me a discount?
The price will not come down.
Men's things are on sale upstairs.
The men were at a loss.
Schoolboys usually look up to great athletes.
Men's clothing is loose fitting.
Ladies before gentlemen.
Men, too, have discovered that there are various roles they can play.
ko: 남자들도 자신들이 할 수 있는 역할이 다양하다는 걸 알게 됐어.

en: Every man should learn how to cook.
ko: 남자라면 누구나 요리하는 법을 배워야 해.

en: Men like to look masculine.
Gentlemen remove their hats in the presence of a lady.
ko: 신사는 숙녀 앞에서 모자를 벗는 법이에요.

en: Men are said to be quick at figures.
Jackets are requested for men.
The man is loading the moving truck on his own.
ko: 그 남자가 혼자서 이삿짐 트럭에 짐을 싣고 있어요.

en: It is safer to say that some men and some women are good at figures.
ko: 어떤 남자들과 어떤 여자들이 계산을 잘한다고 말하는 게 더 정확해요.

en: The greatest cause of stress for men is work, while for women, human relationships come at the top of the list.
ko: 남자의 가장 큰 스트레스 원인은 직장이고, 여자는 인간관계가 1위예요.

en: Some men are slow at figures.
The men are wearing short sleeves.
The men are smiling on cue.
The men have mustaches.
The men are having a barbecue.
It is wrong to think that men are superior to women.
ko: 남자가 여자보다 우월하다고 생각하는 건 잘못이에요.

en: It is ridiculous as well as foolish to think man superior to woman, or woman to man.
ko: 남자가 여자보다, 혹은 여자가 남자보다 우월하다고 생각하는 건 어리석고 말도 안 되는 일이에요.

en: To think that men are superior to women or that women are superior to men is not just stupid, it's also ridiculous.
ko: 남자가 여자보다 낫다거나 여자가 남자보다 낫다고 생각하는 건 멍청할 뿐만 아니라 황당한 일이에요.

en: It is wrong for a man to conceal things from his wife.
ko: 남편이 아내에게 뭔가를 숨기는 건 잘못된 일이에요.

en: It is true of American society that the male is the head of the household.
ko: 미국 사회에서 남성이 가장이라는 건 사실이에요.

en: A man is picking out a tune on the guitar.
ko: 한 남자가 기타로 곡을 연주하고 있어요.

en: Man is as fickle as autumn weather.
Jealousy in a relationship is often brought about by a lack of trust.
ko: 연인 사이의 질투는 보통 신뢰가 부족해서 생겨요.

en: No inequality should be allowed to exist between men and women.
ko: 남녀 사이에 어떤 불평등도 있어서는 안 돼요.

en: Men and women must respect each other.
Why are there differences between the male and the female?
ko: 왜 남성과 여성 사이에 차이가 있을까요?

en: Both men and women won the tennis championship.
Each boy has received his diploma.
The schoolboys marched four abreast.
Each boy student has a school badge on his cap.
ko: 남학생들은 저마다 모자에 학교 배지를 달고 있어요.

en: Both boys and girls should take cooking class in school.
ko: 남학생과 여학생 모두 학교에서 요리 수업을 들어야 해요.

en: The schoolboys teased each other endlessly.
Boys tend to look down on their sisters.
ko: 남자아이들은 자기 여자 형제를 무시하는 경향이 있어요.

en: You must behave yourself like a man.
Act like a man.
You must act like a man.
Men and women went into battle.
The patient implored, "Please ... Break my arms!"
ko: 환자가 애원했어요. "제발... 제 팔을 부러뜨려 주세요!"

en: The man fought bravely but finally gave in.
ko: 그 남자는 용감하게 싸웠지만 결국 굴복했어요.

en: A man stood behind the gate gazing at the house.
ko: 한 남자가 대문 뒤에 서서 집을 빤히 바라보고 있었어요.

en: The man awed the girl with his magic tricks.
ko: 그 남자는 마술로 소녀를 깜짝 놀라게 했어요.

en: The man began to take off his hat, glasses and mask.
ko: 그 남자는 모자와 안경, 마스크를 벗기 시작했어요.

en: The man peeped through a hole in the wall.
ko: 그 남자는 벽에 난 구멍으로 훔쳐봤어요.

en: The man cheated her out of her money.
ko: 그 남자가 그녀의 돈을 사기 쳐서 뺏었어요.

en: The man robbed her of her handbag.
All the man could do was obey them.
ko: 그 남자가 할 수 있는 건 그들의 말을 듣는 것뿐이었어요.

en: The man seized him by the neck.
The man suddenly struck me on the head.
ko: 그 남자가 갑자기 내 머리를 쳤어요.

en: Man is judged by his courage, woman by her charm.
ko: 남자는 용기로, 여자는 매력으로 평가받는 법이에요.

en: The man was found dead in his bedroom in the morning.
ko: 그 남자는 아침에 자신의 침실에서 숨진 채 발견됐어요.

en: The man threw a bag across his shoulder.
Man will not cry in public.
ko: 남자는 사람들 앞에서 울지 않는 법이에요.

en: The man pleaded for mercy, but he was sentenced to twenty years in prison for his crime.
ko: 그 남자는 선처를 호소했지만, 죄를 지어 징역 20년을 선고받았어요.

en: The man terrified the little children.
Man is the hunter, woman is his game.
The man got mad when his wife called him names.
ko: 아내가 욕을 하니까 그 남자가 화를 냈어.

en: A man is never so on trial as in the moment of excessive good fortune.
ko: 사람은 너무 운이 좋을 때가 가장 큰 시험대인 법이야.

en: The man aimed a gun at the detectives.
The man got up and smoked.
The man is wearing a pair of glasses.
The boy is wearing glasses.
The man walked around the corner.
The guy jumped his bill at the restaurant.
ko: 그 남자가 식당에서 돈 안 내고 튀었어.

en: The man left the restaurant without paying his bill.
ko: 그 남자는 밥값도 안 내고 식당을 나갔어.

en: The man left the restaurant without paying.
ko: 그 남자는 돈도 안 내고 식당을 나갔어.

en: The man lit a cigarette with a lighter.
ko: 그 남자가 라이터로 담배에 불을 붙였어.

en: The man came to a dead stop.
ko: 그 남자가 갑자기 우뚝 멈춰 섰어.

en: The man looked at Tom, then vanished through the stage door out into the dark London street.
ko: 그 남자는 톰을 쳐다보더니 무대 뒷문을 통해 어두운 런던 거리로 사라졌어.

en: He stopped by Tom's chair.
ko: 그는 톰의 의자 옆에서 멈춰 섰어.

en: Men are but children of a larger growth.
ko: 남자는 그저 덩치만 큰 어린아이일 뿐이야.

en: The man cheated the old woman out of her money.
The man confessed that he had robbed the old woman.
ko: 그 남자는 할머니를 턴 걸 자백했어.

en: You can't expect a man to change his habits at once, girl.
ko: 얘야, 사람이 습관을 한 번에 고치길 바라면 안 되지.

en: Men judged those women to be odd or dangerous.
ko: 남자들은 그 여자들을 이상하거나 위험하다고 생각했어.

en: The man was hiding in a dense forest.
ko: 그 남자는 울창한 숲속에 숨어 있었어.

en: The guy was too selfish to resist temptation.
ko: 그 남자는 너무 이기적이라 유혹을 참지 못했어.

en: A man is as old as he feels.
ko: 남자는 본인이 느끼는 만큼 늙는 거야.

en: A man is as old as he feels and a woman as old as she looks.
ko: 남자는 본인이 느끼는 만큼 늙고 여자는 겉모습만큼 늙는 거야.

en: A man is as old as he feels, and a woman as old as she looks.
ko: 남자는 본인이 느끼는 만큼 늙고, 여자는 보이는 만큼 늙는 거야.

en: Some boys don't like to bathe regularly.
ko: 어떤 남자애들은 정기적으로 씻는 걸 안 좋아해.

en: If you want a man to propose marriage, feed him well.
ko: 남자가 프러포즈하게 만들고 싶으면 잘 먹여.

en: The boys kept quiet.
I saw the man knocked down and the driver driving away.
ko: 난 그 남자가 차에 치이는 거랑 운전자가 그냥 가버리는 걸 봤어.

en: Boys always want to play football after school.
ko: 남자애들은 항상 방과 후에 축구 하고 싶어 해.

en: All the boys fell in love with Julia.
Each of the boys was eager to join in the race.
ko: 남자애들은 다들 경주에 참여하고 싶어 안달이었어.

en: So the little boy put his hands in his pockets.
ko: 그래서 그 꼬마는 주머니에 손을 넣었어.

en: Boys tend to look down on their younger sisters.
The boy pressed his face against the shop window.
ko: 그 소년은 가게 창문에 얼굴을 바짝 들이댔어.

en: And the boy grew older.
The boy begged for a new bicycle.
ko: 그 소년은 새 자전거를 사달라고 졸랐어.

en: The boy begged for a new bike.
ko: 그 소년은 새 자전거를 사달라고 떼를 썼어.

en: The little boy counts it out on his fingers and said, "Seven."
The boy stuffed cake into his mouth.
ko: 그 소년은 케이크를 입안 가득 밀어 넣었어.

en: I remembered that boys will be boys.
ko: 난 남자애들이 다 그렇지 뭐, 하고 생각했어.

en: Boys will be boys.
All boys like to play baseball.
ko: 남자애들은 다 야구 하는 걸 좋아해.

en: The boy's fingers moved in this pockets. Then he replied, "Eleven."
ko: 그 소년의 손가락이 주머니 속에서 꼼지락거렸어. 그러더니 "열한 개"라고 대답했어.

en: Boys will run risks.
The boy gazed at the player dreamily.
ko: 그 소년은 넋을 놓고 그 선수를 바라봤어.

en: Boys often imitate their sports heroes.
ko: 남자애들은 종종 자기들의 스포츠 영웅을 흉내 내.

en: They are very popular among boys.
ko: 걔네들은 남자애들 사이에서 인기가 진짜 많아.

en: A boy needs a father he can look up to.
ko: 소년에겐 존경할 수 있는 아버지가 필요해.

en: Boys can be trained to behave.
ko: 남자애들도 얌전하게 행동하도록 가르칠 수 있어.

en: There is a great difference between boys and girls.
Few boys are dainty about their food.
Is it a boy or a girl?
Whether it's a son or a daughter, a child is someone you have to take care of until they get married. That's what I think.
ko: 아들이든 딸이든 자식은 결혼할 때까지 돌봐줘야 한다고 생각해요.

en: The boys were quiet.
Some boys made away with all the ripe fruits on my persimmon tree.
ko: 어떤 남자애들이 우리 집 감나무에 있는 잘 익은 감을 다 따 가 버렸어요.

en: A baby boy was born to them.
The boy threw a stone at the dog.
There is nothing wrong with boys wearing cosmetics.
ko: 남자가 화장하는 건 전혀 이상할 게 없어요.

en: A boy is taking his sweet time pushing the cart toward the curb.
ko: 한 소년이 아주 느긋하게 카트를 길가로 밀고 가고 있어요.

en: I saw a boy swimming across the river.
ko: 한 소년이 강을 헤엄쳐서 건너는 걸 봤어요.

en: A boy was giving out newspapers in the rain.
ko: 한 소년이 빗속에서 신문을 돌리고 있었어요.

en: Boys are fond of mischief.
Never love unless you can bear with all the faults of man.
ko: 사람의 모든 단점까지 감당할 수 없다면 사랑하지 마세요.

en: It is up to us to be men.
ko: 진정한 남자가 되는 건 우리 자신에게 달렸어요.

en: You must not compare a man with a woman.
I feel strongly that men and women are equal.
It is advisable for a man or woman to acquire an accomplishment.
ko: 남자든 여자든 기술 하나쯤은 익혀두는 게 좋아요.

en: If you are a man, behave as such.
The men went hunting for lions.
The men loaded the baggage into the truck.
A man on horseback came along the path.
ko: 말을 탄 남자가 길을 따라 왔어요.

en: A man can no more become a woman than a monkey can develop into a man.
ko: 원숭이가 사람이 될 수 없듯이 남자가 여자가 될 수는 없어요.

en: A man shouted something, waving his hand.
ko: 한 남자가 손을 흔들며 뭐라고 소리쳤어요.

en: A man came up and spoke to me.
To my horror, the man took a gun out of his pocket.
ko: 무섭게도 그 남자가 주머니에서 총을 꺼냈어요.

en: I saw a man enter the room.
ko: 어떤 남자가 방에 들어가는 걸 봤어요.

en: I saw a man standing naked under the waterfall.
ko: 폭포 아래에서 어떤 남자가 벌거벗고 서 있는 걸 봤어요.

en: It's getting darker little by little.
Do you have a table in front of the fireplace?
Shift the sofa so that it faces the fireplace.
The clock is above the fireplace.
Clean the ashes out of the fireplace.
The fireplace lends coziness to this room.
ko: 벽난로 덕분에 이 방이 아주 아늑해요.

en: The fireplace was burning brightly.
A warm current runs off the coast of Shikoku.
Did you turn off the heater?
The heater is broken.
The heating doesn't work.
Run the engine till it gets warm.
Ice turns to water when it gets warm.
I think it's getting warmer.
As it got warmer, I took off the sweater.
I took off my sweater because it got warmer.
Since it got warmer, I took off my sweater.
Warm and humid weather increases the number of crimes.
ko: 덥고 습한 날씨는 범죄를 늘어나게 해요.

en: A warm, sunny day is ideal for a picnic.
ko: 따뜻하고 화창한 날은 소풍 가기 딱 좋죠.

en: Dress yourself warmly before you go out.
You should keep yourself warm.
He took the coat off because it was warm.
We can buy hot lunches.
ko: 따뜻한 점심을 사 먹을 수 있어.

en: Wear warm clothes.
On warm days, bears stretch out or lie on their backs with their feet in the air.
ko: 날씨가 따뜻한 날엔 곰들은 기지개를 켜거나 발을 하늘로 들고 등으로 누워 있어.

en: It was a warm day.
After a succession of warm days, the weather became cold.
After continuing days of warm weather, it became cold.
After days of warm weather, it became cold.
I don't like warm winters.
During warm weather, sweating helps man regulate his body temperature.
ko: 더운 날씨에 땀을 흘리는 건 체온 조절에 도움이 돼.

en: Warm human relations were fostered.
Greet him with a warm smile.
I was pleased no end by the cordial welcome.
The last agony was over.
The disadvantage of excellent insulation is that it quickly leads to overheating.
ko: 단열이 너무 잘되면 금방 과열된다는 게 단점이야.

en: The water supply has failed.
The water has been cut off.
An old castle stands on top of the cliff.
ko: 절벽 꼭대기에 오래된 성이 하나 있어.

en: If we decline, what are the alternatives?
ko: 우리가 거절하면 다른 대안이 뭐가 있어?

en: I will never change my mind.
The bullet penetrated him.
The bullet went right through his head.
The bullet penetrated his muscular chest.
ko: 총알이 그의 근육질 가슴을 뚫고 지나갔어.

en: The bullet penetrated his chest.
The bullet glanced off the target.
The bullet penetrated the partition.
The bullet got the policeman in the leg.
The bullet entered above the knee.
We marched under a hail of bullets.
ko: 우린 빗발치는 총알 세례를 받으며 행군했어.

en: The oppressed people cried out for their liberty.
The bullet just shaved his cheek.
The bullet found its mark.
A bullet pierced the helmet.
It's more interesting to travel alone than to go on a group tour.
ko: 단체 관광보다 혼자 여행하는 게 더 재미있어.

en: Organized sports are often an important part of school life, and competitive sports are popular, too.
ko: 운동은 학교 생활의 중요한 부분이고, 경쟁하는 스포츠도 인기가 많아.

en: Strength in unity.
United, we are equal to most anything.
ko: 우리가 단합하면 못 할 게 없어.

en: Please don't say your birthday is over.
ko: 생일 다 지났다는 말은 하지 마.

en: How did you celebrate your birthday?
How was your birthday?
When's your birthday?
It is kind of you to give me a birthday present.
I will give you this bicycle as a birthday present.
It's very kind of you to invite me to your birthday party.
ko: 생일 파티에 초대해 줘서 정말 고마워.

en: Thank you for inviting me to your birthday party.
You shall have a new bicycle for your birthday.
I will give you a new bicycle for your birthday.
You'll get a lot of presents on your birthday.
You shall have a new watch for your birthday.
I look forward to my birthday.
The birthday is the day on which a person was born.
Many happy returns of the day!
Happy birthday!
Have a birthday drink! It's on the house.
There were more people present at the birthday party than was expected.
ko: 생일 파티에 생각보다 사람들이 많이 왔어.

en: Birth is, in a manner, the beginning of death.
There is no cure for birth and death save to enjoy the interval.
ko: 삶과 죽음은 어쩔 수 없으니 그 사이를 즐기는 수밖에 없어.

en: For gall bladder surgery, go down this hall and take a right.
ko: 담낭 수술하려면 이 복도 끝까지 가서 오른쪽으로 가.

en: To make a long story short, he was fired.
To put it briefly, he lacks musical ability.
ko: 한마디로 말해서, 걔는 음악적 재능이 없어.

en: In short, I don't want you to work for that company.
ko: 요약하자면, 난 네가 그 회사에서 일 안 했으면 좋겠어.

en: It was not easy to get a lot of money in a short time.
ko: 짧은 시간에 큰돈을 버는 건 쉽지 않았어.

en: Armed only with a short sword, he drove off all five of his attackers.
ko: 단검 하나만 들고 공격해 온 다섯 명을 다 쫓아냈어.

en: Haste is waste.
Apart from her temper, she's all right.
The short term contract employees were dismissed without notice.
ko: 단기 계약직 직원들이 예고도 없이 해고됐어.

en: You can not master English in a short time.
ko: 짧은 시간 안에 영어를 마스터할 수는 없어.

en: I must have it shortened.
Be sure to drop me a line.
The differing volumes of carbon emissions are plotted in the graph below.
ko: 탄소 배출량 차이가 아래 그래프에 나와 있어.

en: I heard the news that there had been a big earthquake in Awaji.
ko: 아와지에 큰 지진이 났다는 소식을 들었어.

en: Hold onto your husband.
Her husband also wanted custody of the children.
Detective stories are amusing.
The detective took six months to get at the truth of that affair.
ko: 형사가 그 사건의 진실을 밝히는 데 6개월이나 걸렸어.

en: The expedition has postponed its departure to the Antarctic.
The expedition passed through the great jungle.
The expedition's supplies soon gave out.
The explorers discovered a skeleton in the cave.
The explorer bartered with the natives for food.
Seek, and you will find.
Could you help me to find it?
Please look for it.
Did you find what you were looking for?
I found a rare book I had been looking for.
ko: 계속 찾고 있었던 희귀한 책을 드디어 찾았어.

en: Mr. Tanaka, our homeroom teacher, got married.
My homeroom teacher is the same age as my mother.
ko: 우리 담임 선생님은 우리 엄마랑 동갑이야.

en: Homeroom teachers should make every effort to keep in touch with their students.
ko: 담임 선생님은 학생들과 계속 소통하려고 노력해야 해.

en: I'll transfer you to the right person.
Who is the person in charge?
It took courage to sail across the Pacific single-handed.
ko: 혼자서 태평양을 횡단하는 건 큰 용기가 필요했어.

en: Climbing the cliff alone is a bold deed.
ko: 혼자 절벽을 오르는 건 정말 대담한 일이야.

en: The meaning of a word is determined by the context where it is used.
ko: 단어의 의미는 사용되는 문맥에 따라 결정돼.

en: If you don't know the meaning of a word, look it up in a dictionary.
Can you please send ten $15 flashlights immediately?
Did you finish your class registration?
I might flunk the course.
If you buddy up to everybody and anybody, pretty soon people will think you're just a people-pleaser.
ko: 아무한테나 다 맞춰주다 보면 금방 사람 좋은 척하는 사람으로 보일 거야.

en: Nobody would listen to me.
No one respected men like him.
Not a single person arrived late.
ko: 지각한 사람이 단 한 명도 없었어.

en: None of them would admit to being the culprit.
ko: 다들 자기가 범인이라고 인정을 안 하더라고.

en: Not a soul was to be seen in the town.
ko: 마을에 사람이 한 명도 안 보이더라.

en: The argument lasted a long time because nobody would admit to being in the wrong.
ko: 아무도 자기 잘못이라고 인정을 안 해서 싸움이 오래 갔어.

en: I had an argument with my sister about whom to invite.
After I pick some blueberries, I make a tart.
ko: 블루베리 좀 따서 타르트 만들 거야.

en: He forgot to lock the door.
ko: 걔 문 잠그는 거 깜빡했나 봐.

en: No one has failed.
Who are you laughing at?
No one will vote for the budget.
ko: 아무도 예산안에 찬성 안 할 거야.

en: Nobody cares for me.
Nobody can put anything over on the bureau chief.
Nobody was allowed to go out of the room.
Don't let anyone enter the room.
Nobody noticed her absence.
ko: 걔가 없는 걸 아무도 눈치 못 챘어.

en: Do you wonder why no one trusts him?
ko: 왜 아무도 걔를 안 믿는지 궁금해?

en: Nobody came to help him.
Nobody could refuse their invitation.
ko: 아무도 걔네 초대를 거절할 수 없었어.

en: No one will trust his story.
ko: 아무도 걔 말을 안 믿을 거야.

en: No one believed his story.
No one knows his name.
No one could account for his poor examination results.
ko: 걔 시험 성적이 왜 그렇게 안 나왔는지 아무도 설명을 못 해.

en: Nobody seems to have paid attention to what he said.
ko: 아무도 걔 말에 신경 안 쓴 것 같아.

en: It seems that nobody takes any notice of his opinions.
ko: 아무도 걔 의견은 신경 안 쓰는 것 같아.

en: No one took notice of him.
No one gave him a good chance.
ko: 아무도 걔한테 제대로 된 기회를 안 줬어.

en: Nobody can surpass him.
Though it was the original, Amsterdam, and York, were beaten by New York.
ko: 암스테르담이랑 요크가 원래 있었지만 결국 뉴욕한테 밀렸어.

en: Nobody bowed to him.
I have a cough and a little fever.
ko: 나 기침도 나고 열도 좀 있어.

en: Nobody doubts his fitness for the position.
ko: 아무도 걔가 그 자리에 적임자라는 걸 의심 안 해.

en: Nobody answered the telephone.
No one has ever gone into heaven except the one who came from heaven – the Son of man.
ko: 하늘에서 내려온 인자 말고는 하늘에 올라간 사람이 아무도 없어.

en: It's not something anyone would be ashamed of.
Everybody tends to be lazy.
No one loves war.
None of them is alive.
No person can decide when someone should die.
ko: 누가 언제 죽을지는 아무도 결정할 수 없어.

en: Everyone was friendly to the new girl.
ko: 다들 새로 온 애한테 친절하게 대해줬어.

en: Nobody can exist without food.
Everyone is afraid of doing new things.
ko: 누구나 새로운 일을 하는 건 두려워해.

en: No one is coming.
No one was present.
No one really knows what a UFO is like.
ko: UFO가 진짜 어떻게 생겼는지는 아무도 몰라.

en: No one replied to the question.
Nobody having any question, he ended the lecture.
No one should force his views on others.
ko: 자기 생각을 남한테 강요하면 안 돼.

en: Nobody could believe what he saw.
ko: 자기가 본 걸 아무도 믿을 수 없었어.

en: Nobody could remember the sequence of events.
ko: 일이 일어난 순서를 아무도 기억 못 했어.

en: No one can be a poet.
ko: 아무나 시인이 될 수 있는 건 아니야.

en: Nobody can control us.
It goes without saying that nobody can come between us.
ko: 우리 사이를 아무도 갈라놓을 수 없다는 건 당연해.

en: Nobody came to help me.
Nobody came to my rescue.
No one helped me.
Nobody bore me out.
ko: 내 말이 맞다는 걸 아무도 증명해 주지 않았어.

en: Nobody backed up what I said.
ko: 내가 한 말을 아무도 뒷받침해주지 않았어.

en: Nobody listened to me.
Nobody answered my question.
ko: 아무도 내 질문에 대답 안 했어.

en: Nobody perceived me entering the room.
ko: 내가 방에 들어오는 걸 아무도 못 봤어.

en: None can get away from death.
Nobody answered the door.
Nobody can ever help me.
ko: 그 누구도 날 도와줄 수 없어.

en: No one is free from faults.
Nobody taught me.
No one is to leave without permission.
Nobody was able to suggest a solution.
Nobody will regard us as office workers.
ko: 아무도 우릴 회사원으로 생각 안 할 거야.

en: He resented everyone's being very quiet.
ko: 그는 다들 너무 조용히 있는 게 싫었어.

en: No one excels him in English.
No one will bother to do such a thing.
Now they're frightened of leaving it.
ko: 이제 다들 그걸 두고 가는 걸 무서워해.

en: Every man has his weak points.
Nobody came to the party.
Heaven knows why.
No one can say that.
Nobody having any more to say, the meeting was closed.
ko: 더 할 말이 없어서 회의는 끝났어.

en: Nobody had anything more to say.
No one had anything left to say.
ko: 아무도 더 이상 할 말이 남지 않았어.

en: Nobody can understand it.
No one knows how it came to pass.
ko: 어떻게 그런 일이 일어났는지 아무도 몰라.

en: Nobody envied the old man, who was a millionaire.
ko: 백만장자인 그 노인을 부러워하는 사람은 아무도 없었어.

en: No one could solve the problem.
No one knew how to answer the question.
ko: 그 질문에 어떻게 답해야 할지 아무도 몰랐어.

en: No one could find the answer.
No one can move the big box.
ko: 아무도 그 큰 상자를 못 옮겨.

en: No one caught on to the joke.
ko: 그 농담을 아무도 이해 못 했어.

en: No one knows the fact.
None of us thought he was to blame for the accident.
ko: 우리 중 누구도 그 사고가 걔 탓이라고 생각 안 했어.

en: Nobody is to blame for the accident.
None have finished the work.
Nobody failed in the tactics.
ko: 그 전술에 실패한 사람은 아무도 없었어.

en: Nobody knows about the plan.
Nobody noticed that the picture was hung upside down.
ko: 그림이 거꾸로 걸려 있다는 걸 아무도 눈치 못 챘어.

en: No one was present at the meeting.
No one was in a hurry to leave the party.
ko: 서둘러 파티를 떠나려는 사람이 아무도 없었어.

en: No one could solve the puzzle.
No one called my attention to it.
ko: 아무도 나한테 그걸 주의 주지 않았어.

en: No one can go in there.
No one thinks so.
Nobody ever comes to see us in this out-of-the-way village.
ko: 이런 외딴 마을까지 우리를 보러 오는 사람은 아무도 없어.

en: Nobody has solved the problem.
Nobody can solve this problem.
Don't let anyone enter or approach this room.
ko: 이 방에 아무도 들어오거나 가까이 못 오게 해.

en: I didn't think anyone could fix this watch.
ko: 이 시계를 누가 고칠 수 있을 거라고 생각 안 했어.

en: No one can operate this machine.
ko: 이 기계는 아무도 다룰 줄 몰라.

en: It is desirable that nobody should be hurt.
Everybody plays the game of love.
We could all see it coming, couldn't we?
Everyone estimates her work highly.
ko: 다들 걔가 한 일을 높게 평가해.

en: Everybody speaks well of her.
Everyone speaks well of him.
Everybody had looked on him as a good-for-nothing.
Everybody looked up to him.
Everybody regards him as honest.
Everyone considers him to be honest.
Everybody loves him.
Everyone loves him.
Everybody knows that he is the last man to break his promise.
ko: 걔가 약속 어길 사람이 아니라는 건 다들 알아.

en: Everyone recognized him as a brilliant pianist.
Everybody admired his courage.
Everyone admired his courage.
Everybody knows his name.
Everyone recognized his skill.
Everyone opposed it, but Sally and Bob got married all the same.
ko: 다들 반대했는데, 샐리랑 밥은 결국 결혼했어.

en: Everyone strives for efficiency but few seem to attain it.
ko: 다들 효율을 따지지만, 실제로 그렇게 하는 사람은 별로 없어.

en: Not everyone is properly rewarded for his efforts.
Every man desires to live long, but no man wishes to be old.
ko: 누구나 오래 살고 싶어 하지만 늙는 건 싫어해.

en: Everyone admitted that the earth is a sphere.
ko: 지구가 둥글다는 건 누구나 다 인정했어.

en: Everybody knows that he likes her and vice versa.
ko: 걔네 둘이 서로 좋아하는 건 다들 알아.

en: We are all longing for peace in the world.
ko: 우리 모두 세계 평화를 바라고 있어.

en: Everyone has a right to enjoy his liberty.
Everyone mistakes me for my brother.
Everybody says I look like my father.
Everyone said that I was wrong.
Nobody can escape death.
Everyone loves to hear praise, but over-praise has the opposite effect of sounding insincere.
ko: 누구나 칭찬 듣는 건 좋아하지만, 너무 과하면 오히려 진심이 아닌 것처럼 들려.

en: Everyone seeks happiness.
Everybody shouted for joy.
Everybody wants permanent peace.
To my amusement, everyone believed my story.
It is not given to everybody to study abroad.
ko: 유학 가는 건 아무나 할 수 있는 게 아니야.

en: Everyone's saying it.
Everyone knows the law.
Easy money is on Mulligan.
Everyone recognizes the boy as a real genius.
ko: 다들 그 애를 진짜 천재라고 인정해.

en: It was natural that everyone should like the girl.
ko: 다들 그 애를 좋아하는 건 당연했어.

en: Everybody expected that the experiment would result in failure.
ko: 다들 그 실험이 실패할 거라고 예상했어.

en: Everyone will accept that idea in principle.
ko: 다들 원칙적으로는 그 생각에 동의할 거야.

en: Everyone knew the song.
Everyone says the view from here is beautiful.
ko: 여기서 보는 경치가 예쁘다고 다들 그래.

en: Everyone always speaks well of Tom.
The little girl will go astray if no one cares much about her.
ko: 아무도 신경 안 써주면 그 어린 여자애는 엇나갈 거야.
